page.title: 08THE COKING PLANT WINGERWORTH
page.content: The{NCB Carbonisation and Chemical {Plant}converts coal to coke,this is used for solid fuel fires. The coal is baked for 17 hours. Each oven takes in 15 tonnes of coal at one end and produces 11 tonnes of coke at the other. The carbonisation process results in many useful by-products. They are: { Road Tar { Methanol { Electrode Pitch -}used for the manufacture of electrodes for welding. { Pitch { Gas -}produced to power the boilers and some is sold to private industry. { Sulphuric Acid { Sulphate of Ammonia -}fertilisers { Steam -}raised in the boiler house to power turbo alternators, which produces all the Plants {electricity
